DataElement.preferredName: Wechsler Memory Scale - Fourth Edition Spatial Addition Scaled Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the scaled score for the Spatial Addition subtest in the Wechsler Memory Scale, Fourth Edition.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Wechsler Memory Scale - Fourth Edition Spatial Addition Scaled Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The fourth version of the Wechsler Memory Scale that was published in 2009. It is a neuropsychological test designed to measure different memory functions in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 90 years._A subtest of the Wechsler Memory Scale, 4th Edition that evaluates visual-spatial working memory using a visual addition task. The subject is shown, sequentially, two grids with blue and red circles. The subject is then asked to add or subtract the location of the circles based on a set of rules._Conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale that allows for a numerical comparison.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The fourth version of the Wechsler Memory Scale that was published in 2009. It is a neuropsychological test designed to measure different memory functions in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 90 years.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subtest of the Wechsler Memory Scale, 4th Edition that evaluates visual-spatial working memory using a visual addition task. The subject is shown, sequentially, two grids with blue and red circles. The subject is then asked to add or subtract the location of the circles based on a set of rules.:Conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale that allows for a numerical comparison.

Concepts.definition: A subtest of the Wechsler Memory Scale, 4th Edition that evaluates visual-spatial working memory using a visual addition task. The subject is shown, sequentially, two grids with blue and red circles. The subject is then asked to add or subtract the location of the circles based on a set of rules.
Conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale that allows for a numerical comparison.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale in the Wechsler Memory Scale - Fourth Edition.
